intro: Ranunculus bidens, commonly known as the two-seeded buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features delicate, bright yellow flowers with numerous small, petal-like sepals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and palmately divided leaves. Its flowers bloom in early spring, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Ranunculus bidens is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
